title: No-Knead Pot Bread
body: A high-hydration, long-rest dough baked in a preheated heavy pot for steam and oven spring.
ingredients: 3 cups (360 g) all-purpose or bread flour
steps: Whisk flour, yeast, and salt. Add water until a shaggy dough forms. Cover and rest 12–18 hours at room temp.
Turn dough onto floured surface, fold several times, rest 15 minutes. Shape into a ball; proof 1–2 hours.
Preheat oven to 450°F (232°C) with heavy pot inside (30 minutes).
Drop dough onto parchment, score, lower into hot pot, cover; bake 30 minutes. Uncover and bake 10–15 minutes more until deep golden.
source_citation: Lahey, J., & Myhrvold, R. (2006, November 8). No-Knead Bread. The New York Times. (Technique popularization; adapt for home use.)

title: Sheet-Pan Paprika Chicken
body: Crispy paprika-garlic chicken thighs roasted with potatoes for a one-pan dinner.
steps: Heat oven to 425°F (218°C). Toss potatoes with half the oil and half the seasonings on a sheet pan.
Pat chicken dry; rub with remaining oil and seasonings. Place skin-side up on the pan.
Roast 30–40 minutes until potatoes are tender and chicken is 165°F (74°C) at thickest part; rest 5 minutes.
source_citation: U.S. Department of Agriculture. (2020). Kitchen Companion: Your Safe Food Handbook. USDA. (For doneness temps.)

title: Sunny Lemon Bars
body: A classic lemon custard baked over a shortbread crust, finished with powdered sugar.
ingredients: Crust: 1 cup (120 g) flour, 1/4 cup (50 g) sugar, 1/2 cup (113 g) butter, pinch salt
Filling: 3/4 cup (150 g) sugar, 2 tbsp flour, 3 eggs, 1/2 cup lemon juice, zest 1 lemon
steps: Heat oven to 350°F (177°C). Line 8×8 pan with parchment.
Crust: mix dry, cut in butter to sandy crumbs; press into pan; bake 15 minutes.
Filling: whisk sugar, flour, eggs, juice, zest. Pour onto hot crust; bake 20–25 minutes until just set.
Cool fully; dust with powdered sugar; cut.
source_citation: McGee, H. (2004). On Food and Cooking: The science and lore of the kitchen. Scribner. (For custard/curd principles.)
